intro: Polygala houtboshiana, commonly known as the Houtbosh polygala, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
